item.title: Fibres of Deceit: Can We Trust What We Read (Especially When Goblins Write It)?
item.description:
By Beatrice Butterburrow, Special Correspondent

The age of the Wizarding Wireless Network (WWN) has brought unparalleled access to information. Need the latest Quaffle scores? Boom, there they are. Want to know if Gilderoy Lockhart is actually opening a new charm school? (Please Merlin, no.) The WWN delivers. But with this deluge of data comes a darker current: the rise of misinformation. Sound familiar? Think of it as a particularly nasty Bubotuber pus â€“ prolific, unpleasant, and shockingly hard to get rid of.
